Explanation: The doctor did not suggest an MRI of the brain, which is specifically indicated to rule out structural abnormalities or lesions causing headaches.
The doctor suggested a Head CT scan to rule out structural abnormalities in the brain, which aligns with the need to assess for acute intracranial issues.
The doctor did not suggest blood tests specifically for infection or inflammation, but rather for ruling out underlying medical conditions.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations related to thyroid function tests or similar justifications for ruling out thyroid dysfunction.
The doctor did not suggest an electrolyte panel or any investigation related to electrolyte imbalances.
The doctor did not suggest an ophthalmologic examination, which is necessary to rule out eye-related issues contributing to the headaches.
The doctor did not suggest a lumbar puncture or any investigation with a similar justification related to suspicion of meningitis or subarachnoid hemorrhage.
